newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia provides A$275 mln to aid programme.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia provides A$275 mln to aid programme.

text.p: Australian Foreign Affairs Minister Alexander Downer said on Thursday that Australia would provide A$275 million over the next three years to the International Development Association (IDA).
IDA is the concessional lending arm of the World Bank, providing interest free loans over 30 to 40 years (with a 10 year grace period) to the world's poorest countries.

"At a time of fiscal stringency, the generous funding of IDA clearly demonstrates the government's strong commitment to sharpening the humanitarian focus of the aid programme," Downer said in a statement.
Downer said Australia's contribution was A$34 million above its share agreed in negotiations with other IDA donors.
He said A$111 million of Australia's total contribution would be paid into an interim trust fund starting in the 1996/97 June 30 financial year.
